intro: Olyra hoehnei, commonly known as the Hoehne's olyra, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Olyra hoehnei is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
